body_html:
Hi, I had a similar problem with which I struggled.

The details of my problem and the solution can be found at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/38051143/no-broadcasting-for-tf-matmul-in-tensorflow/38056381.

Briefly, I had to multiply vectors of a 4D tensor by a matrix and I wanted the output as 4D tensor.
This is trickier when one uses placeholders with undefined dimension sizes. The solution on stack overflow essentially shows how to restore the original tensor rank after using tf.reshape(X, [-1, N]).

body:
Hi, I had a similar problem with which I struggled.

The details of my problem and the solution can be found at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/38051143/no-broadcasting-for-tf-matmul-in-tensorflow/38056381.

Briefly, I had to multiply vectors of a 4D tensor by a matrix and I wanted the output as 4D tensor.
This is trickier when one uses placeholders with undefined dimension sizes. The solution on stack overflow essentially shows how to restore the original tensor rank after using `tf.reshape(X, [-1, N])`.
